intro: Bermudiana restioides, commonly known as the Bermuda restioid, is a flowering plant native to the island of Bermuda. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
